abstract: Nearly 20 Arab nations submit resolution to United Nations General Assembly seeking right of Palestine, despite having nonmember observer status, to raise its flag at gates of UN headquarters; Jewish groups including B’nai B’rith oppose resolution, citing Hamas's hostility to Israel among its objections.
lead_paragraph: The General Assembly received a draft resolution calling for the organization’s two “nonmember observer states” to be granted the right to raise their flags.

headline.main: Palestinians Want to Raise Flag at U.N.
headline.print_headline: United Nations; Palestinians Want to Raise Flag at U.N.

snippet: The General Assembly received a draft resolution calling for the organization’s two “nonmember observer states” to be granted the right to raise their flags.
